education.area: B.S. Computer Science | Regents Scholar | GPA: 3.99/4.0

3D/CG: Computer Graphics, 3D User Interaction, 3D Asset Design

publications.name: RFCL: Reverse Forward Curriculum Learning for Extreme Sample and Demonstration Efficiency in RL
publications.publisher: Stone Tao, Arth Shukla, Tse-kai Chan, Hao Su

work.name: Qualcomm Institute (Calit2)
work.summary: Python, PyTorch, Unreal Engine, Kubernetes, Docker
highlights: Co-developed interactive 3D avatars of historical figures in Unreal Engine 5, driven by large language models and text-to-speech/animation pipeline. Implemented a multi-speaker tracking module to drive a virtual avatar’s attention and face/body motion in multiplayer VR or through webcam using Google Mediapipe.
Developed a real-time audio-to-face pipeline that receives audio input from text-to-speech and uses NVIDIA Audio2Face through Rest API to animate facial movements on a 3D avatar.
Researching holistic multi-modal context co-speech gesture generation for animation and game engines.

work.name: Advisor: Prof. Hao Su
work.summary: Python, PyTorch, JAX, Gymnasium, Docker, Kubernetes
highlights: Researched demo-guided deep reinforcement learning methods to effectively solve long-horizon, sparse tasks.

Benchmarked various state-of-the-art demonstration-guided deep RL methods, including RLPD, IQL, etc., on ManiSkill2, D4RL, and Meta-World tasks. Performed experiments on Kubernetes cluster using Docker.
Implementing RL baselines for the ManiSkill3 robotics environment.

work.name: Nearal
highlights: Developed various features for Nearal’s Android application, including a dynamic onboarding screen, a floating login interface, and an improved sign-up process, using Kotlin and Android Studio.
Refined multiple app fragments, ensuring optimal functionality for both logged-in and logged-out users, and resolved critical issues such as photo display inconsistencies and profile identification.

teaching.name: UCSD Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE)
highlights: CSE 152A: Taught Computer Vision and Deep Learning concepts for a class of 150+ students and assisted 20+ students weekly with programming assignments in office hours.

awards.title: Regents Scholarship
awards.summary: The most prestigious merit scholarship awarded to undergraduate students at the University of California.

awards.title: USA Computing Olympiad - Platinum Division
awards.summary: Highest division in the most prestigious national pre-college algorithmic programming competition.
